description.narrative: Mainstreaming SLM in Rangeland areas of Ngamiland District landscapes for improved livelihoods
first-order administrative division

activity-description.narrative: Provide technical support for sustainable land management practices from improved livelihoods

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

description.narrative: Effective governance framework and markets provide incentives for livestock offtake and compliance with SLM
Multistakeholder forum for mainstreaming SLM issues in national and regional policies plans and strategies

comment.narrative: Existing multisectoral institution is limited to multiple government sectors
Active participation from government NGOs water and land user groups community trusts community leaders private sector by project end

Not yet established However virtually all project stakeholders have been consulted over the two first quarters of 2015 It is these same stakeholders that will comprise the forum The forum will be established and a schedule of themes for discussion developed and at least one forum meeting facilitated
Active participation from government NGOs water and land user groups community trusts community leaders private sector by project end

description.narrative: Offtake rate for cattle

comment.narrative: Tbd during range assessments under the economic section
Tbd after range assessments
The Botswana Meat Commission owned Maun Abattoir is shutting down for renovations that are designed to increase offtake from about 80 cattle per day to 120 cattle per day
Tbd after range assessments

description.narrative: Revenue from nonbeef livestock products

comment.narrative: Zero
Tbd during feasibility studies for setting up a processing and marketing plant

No progress as yet However individuals and communities like those of Habu village with interest and experience in leather processing skull painting etc have been identified and will in the near future be assisted to participate in a ground breaking workshop as a precursor to feasibility studies

description.narrative: Effective range management improves range condition and flow of ecosystem services to support livelihoods of local communities
Extent of uncontrolled fires

comment.narrative: 10000 ha affected by uncontrolled fire
Fireaffected area reduced by 50 most of the years and by 100 in two out of the five years of the project
No progress as yet This activity awaits a workshop to develop the draft Tsodilo Hills Fire Management Strategy which will be held in October 2015
Fireaffected area reduced by 50 most of the years and by 100 in two out of the five years of the project
No progress as yet This activity awaits a workshop to develop the draft Tsodilo Hills Fire Management Strategy which will be held in October 2015

description.narrative: Area of riparian woodland preserved

comment.narrative: 10000 ha of riparian woodland lost around Lake Ngami
200 meter buffer zone reclaimed by project end

Received a special request for assistance from the Lake Ngami Conservation Trust to help with management of the Lake Solicited and obtained expressions of interest to provide manual labour for reclamation of Lake Ngami riparian zone from the University of Botswanas Environmental Club Commencement of reclamation activities shall await the projects procurement of equipment The completion of our integrated range assessment study of Lake Ngami and environs will also provide further guidance on how to best manage the riparian zone
200 meter buffer zone reclaimed by project end

Received a special request for assistance from the Lake Ngami Conservation Trust to help with management of the Lake Solicited and obtained expressions of interest to provide manual labour for reclamation of Lake Ngami riparian zone from the University of Botswanas Environmental Club Commencement of reclamation activities shall await the projects procurement of equipment The completion of our integrated range assessment study of Lake Ngami and environs will also provide further guidance on how to best manage the riparian zone

description.narrative: Area affected by bush encroachment

comment.narrative: 100000 ha affected by overgrazing and bush encroachment
Decrease by 25 by the end of the project
No progress as yet pending completion of integrated range assessment of all pilot areas The assessment studies and the emergent land use maps will guide scope and target for management interventions
Decrease by 25 by the end of the project
No progress as yet pending completion of integrated range assessment of all pilot areas The assessment studies and the emergent land use maps will guide scope and target for management interventions

description.narrative: Area of rangeland with improved grass and herbaceous species cover

comment.narrative: 64000 ha denuded in ranches
Approx 40 25600 ha in 4 ranches rehabilitated by project end

Range management interventions in ranches have not as yet been implemented Emerging from consultations with commercial farmers many are not happy with the selection of demonstration ranches A more transparent sampling technique for selection of demonstration ranches will have to be devised and agreed to by the farmersAlso held discussions with Ecoexist an organisation working in Ngamiland to reduce humanelephant conflict Their interventions could prove highly useful to commercial farmers in the project who have comlained bitterly about the negative impact elephants are having on their ranches ie cutting of fences
Approx 40 25600 ha in 4 ranches rehabilitated by project end

Range management interventions in ranches have not as yet been implemented Emerging from consultations with commercial farmers many are not happy with the selection of demonstration ranches A more transparent sampling technique for selection of demonstration ranches will have to be devised and agreed to by the farmersAlso held discussions with Ecoexist an organisation working in Ngamiland to reduce humanelephant conflict Their interventions could prove highly useful to commercial farmers in the project who have comlained bitterly about the negative impact elephants are having on their ranches ie cutting of fences

description.narrative: Incidence of late dry season fires

comment.narrative: Fires burn annually at Tsodilo
Frequency reduced to every three years

Participated in two workshops organised by BIOCHOBE and the Department of Forestry and Range Resources investigating the efficacy of an Advanced Fire Information Management System AFIS The system is designed to facilitate remote detection of fires as a means to expedite ground level assets necessary to put out the fire It is hoped that atleast 40 of the Ngamiland districts land surface would be put under surveillance as part of the projects fire management strategy in the Tsodilo Hills area
Frequency reduced to every three years

Participated in two workshops organised by BIOCHOBE and the Department of Forestry and Range Resources investigating the efficacy of an Advanced Fire Information Management System AFIS The system is designed to facilitate remote detection of fires as a means to expedite ground level assets necessary to put out the fire It is hoped that atleast 40 of the Ngamiland districts land surface would be put under surveillance as part of the projects fire management strategy in the Tsodilo Hills area

description.narrative: Capacity of key land management institutions for SLM

comment.narrative: Summary baseline capacity score 28
Raise to 50 and improving by the end of the project

Most if not all relevant land management institutions are now members of the projects Technical Reference Group a development which has set the stage for a capacity self assessment to be undertaken and a capacity building training plan developed therefrom
Raise to 50 and improving by the end of the project

Most if not all relevant land management institutions are now members of the projects Technical Reference Group a development which has set the stage for a capacity self assessment to be undertaken and a capacity building training plan developed therefrom

description.narrative: Economic returns per land unit

comment.narrative: Tbd during range assessments which will include establishment of economic returns from different land uses ranches and communal rangelands
Increase returns by a quarter of the baseline every year after the 2nd year
Progress pending completion and implementation of management objectives as recommended by the integrated range assessment studies
Increase returns by a quarter of the baseline every year after the 2nd year
Progress pending completion and implementation of management objectives as recommended by the integrated range assessment studies

description.narrative: Stocking rates in line with the prevailing condition of the rangeland

comment.narrative: Tbd during the range assessment studies of this project
Tbd during the project and implemented in 4 ranches by project end

Following consultations with commercial farmers it has been established that stocking rates are generally difficult to enforce as a result of the extended nature of ranch ownership ie ranches are coowned by multiple members of one family who each contribute any number of cattle to the holding Moreover because of the unreliability of the Botswana Meat Commission in buying cattle for slaughter from farmers livestock from communal rangelands is often deliberately led into commercial ranching zone when word of imminent sale of livestock from the latter has been intercepted Government has since erected a protective fence between Haina Veld commercial ranches and communal areas but it is currently breached in many places due to both elephant and human vandals These issues shall be duly considered and used in the generation of management objectives and land use plans specific to the Haina Veld area
Tbd during the project and implemented in 4 ranches by project end

Following consultations with commercial farmers it has been established that stocking rates are generally difficult to enforce as a result of the extended nature of ranch ownership ie ranches are coowned by multiple members of one family who each contribute any number of cattle to the holding Moreover because of the unreliability of the Botswana Meat Commission in buying cattle for slaughter from farmers livestock from communal rangelands is often deliberately led into commercial ranching zone when word of imminent sale of livestock from the latter has been intercepted Government has since erected a protective fence between Haina Veld commercial ranches and communal areas but it is currently breached in many places due to both elephant and human vandals These issues shall be duly considered and used in the generation of management objectives and land use plans specific to the Haina Veld area

description.narrative: No of farmers practicing conservation agriculture

comment.narrative: Zero
30 every other year trained and given extension support

Work with farmers has not yet commenced Instead discussions with Pabalelo Trust one of few non governmental organisations within Ngamiland district specializing in conservation agriculture have been held Discussions with more potential civil society partners on ways and means to promote CA among other things within the district are soon to be held
30 every other year trained and given extension support

Work with farmers has not yet commenced Instead discussions with Pabalelo Trust one of few non governmental organisations within Ngamiland district specializing in conservation agriculture have been held Discussions with more potential civil society partners on ways and means to promote CA among other things within the district are soon to be held

description.narrative: No of farmers practicing in improved and effective herd management

comment.narrative: Zero
30 farmers enrolled for participation in the project 20 initially and 10 more added by project end

No progress as yet pending completion of integrated rangeland assessment studies which are expected to objectively guide selection of area and participating farmers Held preliminary discussions with communal rangeland farmers association representatives

description.narrative: To mainstream SLM in rangeland areas of Ngamiland District productive landscapes for improved livelihoods
Hectares of rangeland that are under improved management

comment.narrative: Zero

1 million hectares by project end
In addition it is expected that project lessons can be replicated to an additional 45 million hectares postproject

The project office has been erected furnished and officially opened About 90 of primary and secondary stakeholders identified in the PRODOC have been mobilized and consulted regarding their roles in the project A project board andor Project Steering Committee comprised of representatives of relevant local government agencies civil society organisations and print media has been established to provide policy and governance oversight to the Project Management Unit Moreover a Technical Reference Group TRG to assist in the review of consultancy Terms of Reference and other technical outputs has also been established Preparation of an Integrated range assessment studies to establish initial range and socioeconomic condition prior to management intervention are about to be undertaken following completion of draft terms of reference

1 million hectares by project end
In addition it is expected that project lessons can be replicated to an additional 45 million hectares postproject

The project office has been erected furnished and officially opened About 90 of primary and secondary stakeholders identified in the PRODOC have been mobilized and consulted regarding their roles in the project A project board andor Project Steering Committee comprised of representatives of relevant local government agencies civil society organisations and print media has been established to provide policy and governance oversight to the Project Management Unit Moreover a Technical Reference Group TRG to assist in the review of consultancy Terms of Reference and other technical outputs has also been established Preparation of an Integrated range assessment studies to establish initial range and socioeconomic condition prior to management intervention are about to be undertaken following completion of draft terms of reference

description.narrative:
Component 1
1. Hectares of rangeland under improved management
2. Area of rangeland with improved grass and herbaceous species cover
3. Area of riparian woodland preserved or rehabilitated
4. Incidences of late dry season woodland fires
5. Extent of uncontrolled wildland fires
6. Area affected by bush encroachment
7. Number of farmers practicing Conservation Agriculture
8. Number of farmers practicing improved and effective herd management
9. Stocking rates inline with prevailing conditions of the rangeland
10. Number of farmers with improved livelihoods
11. Economic returns per land unit
12. Capacity of key land management institutions for SLM
Component 2
1. Multi-stakeholder forum for mainstreaming SLM issues in national and regional policies, plans and strategies
2. Revenue from Non beef livestock products
3. Offtake rate for cattle

comment.narrative:
Component 1
1. In terms of mainstreaming SLM in rangeland areas of Ngamiland District productive landscapes for improved livelihoods, there is no baseline i.e. (zero)
2. 64 000 ha denuded in commercial ranches
3. 10 000 ha of riparian woodland lost around lake Ngami
4. Fires burn annually at Tsodilo enclave
5. 10 000 ha affected by uncontrolled fires
6. 100 000 ha affected by over grazing and bush encroachment
7. 100 farmers practicing Conservation Agriculture (supported by Department of Crop Production and Southern African Regional Environment Program)
8. Zero baseline for farmers practicing improved and effective herd management
9. zero baseline line for stocking rates
10. Zero baseline for farmers with improved livelihoods
11. Zero baseline for economic returns per land unit
12. Key land management institutional capacity is 28%
Component 2
1. Existing multi-sectoral institution is limited to multiple government sectors only
2. Zero baseline for revenue from non beef livestock products
3. Cattle offtake rate from Ngamiland abattoirs is 100 cattle per day

Undertake Gender Analysis Study
Component 1.1; Local level land use plans Target: Produce local level land use plan for Lake Ngami and Tsodilo
Component 1.2 Target: 10 tonnes of charcoal produced
Component 1.3 Target: 30,000Ha cleared of bush encroachment
Component 1.4 Target: 120 people trained in fire management
Component 1.5 Target: 40 Farmers trained in Conservation Agreements
Component 2.1 Target: 4 Multi Stakeholder dialogues held in 2018
Component 2.2 Target: 1 feasibility study on Community run abattoir in 2018
Component 2.3 Target: 1 community cluster group trained in leather works in 2018.
Component 2.4 Target: 1 benchmarking trip in SADC to facilitate acquisition of beef market in 2018.

Gender Analysis study for Ngamiland SLM Project completed
Component 1.1 Local level land use plans for Lake Ngami and Tsodilo completed
Component 1.2 2 tonnes of charcoal produced
Component 1.3 20,000Ha cleared of bush encroachment in Lake Ngami
Component 1.4 120 people trained in fire management
Component 1.5 52 Farmers trained in Conservation Agreements
Component 2.1 4 Multi Stakeholder dialogues held
Component 2.2 1 feasibility study on Community run abattoir completed
Component 2.3 1 community cluster group trained in leather works
Component 2.4 1 benchmarking trip to South Africa undertaken.

Component 1: - Conduct Project terminal evaluation - Support Tsodilo Hills Heritage Challenge - Support Lake Nagmi Braai Wood and Charcoal Production - Support matute-a-mongongo
Component 2: - Gumare community dialogue - Maun regional dialogue
